node.title: Farmers divided on what makes Australia's tastiest lamb, but 120,000 tasters can't be wrong
node.description: Selecting tasty, juicy and tender lamb is set to become easier with new grading standards, but the move is dividing the sheepmeat industry.Â
node.content:
["Selecting tasty, juicy and tender lamb in the supermarket or butcher is set to become easier with a new grading system, but the move is dividing the sheepmeat industry.\u00a0\u00a0", "For more than 20 years, Australian beef has been graded by Meat Standards Australia (MSA) \u2014\u00a0an internationally accredited system that rates meat quality,\u00a0underpinning supermarket labels such as \"premium\", \"finest\"\u00a0and \"everyday\".", "Now lamb is set to follow suit. \u00a0Within 12 months, the industry's national meat standards body will roll out sheepmeat grading to help consumers fill their shopping basket with confidence, knowing the meat will do as it says on the label.", "But\u00a0not\u00a0all farmers are on board with how the\u00a0cuts will be defined.", "After years of research, a new MSA program has been developed for lamb\u00a0with plans to take it from Australian abattoirs to supermarkets next year.", "It is a \"cut by cooking method\"\u00a0system, meaning lamb's eating quality\u00a0will be assessed for specific cuts and for both roasting and pan-frying.", "\"I'd say within the next 12 months we will see [meat processing] plants come online with the MSA grading system,\" MSA program manager David Packer said.", "He is working with processors and retailers to launch the system that will allow lamb to be rated, branded, and priced consistently with its eating quality attributes.", "", "
James Gilmore with the $165,000 ram sold in September 2021.(Supplied: Studstocksales.com)
", "But not all of Australia's most prominent sheep farmers and lamb brands planned to use the new system.", "
The great taste debate
", "Tattykeel stud in NSW sold a ram for $165,000 this September, smashing the record price for an Australian meat sheep at a sale that grossed $5.6 million across 400 sheep lots.", "Tattykeel, owned by the Gilmore family, did not plan to use MSA grading for their lamb products.", "The business already marketed\u00a0its lamb directly to restaurants using its own criteria for eating quality.", "These included a low-fat melting point and high omega acid content, neither of which were measured by MSA.", "\"You can have huge intramuscular fat levels but if it's not melting you won't have the effect on taste,\" Tattykeel co-owner James Gilmore said.", "", "
Tattykeel's Graham Gilmore says restaurants return for more after tasting their lamb.(Supplied: Graham Gilmore)
", "Mr Packer said the MSA model for eating quality was underpinned by 120,000 blind taste tests over a decade of development.", "\"These are related to things we can directly measure like intramuscular fat, lean meat yield, and hot carcass weight.", "\"We're absolutely sure that we have got the right traits but it doesn't mean we won't look for more.\"", "
Proof in the paddock
", "", "
Craig Heggaton, WAMMCO chair and sheep farmer, says MSA grading is a game-changer for the lamb industry.(ABC Great Southern: Tom Edwards)
", "Craig Heggaton is a sheep farmer and chairman of West Australian lamb processor WAMMCO.", "Unlike the Gilmores of Tattykeel, he has been using genetic breeding data to improve the commercial value and eating quality of his sheep.", "Likewise, WAMMCO is investing in new technologies to assess lamb carcasses' lean meat and intramuscular fat, which will give farmers more feedback and underpin the MSA grading of its lamb.", "\"The data is the most important thing we look at. It is highly indexed and highly accurate,\" Mr Heggaton said.", "MSA was\u00a0developed by Meat and Livestock Australia, a Commonwealth-funded industry body with 49,600 members.", "More than 26,000 sheep farmers were registered with MSA\u00a0and MSA-licensed abattoirs process\u00a057 per cent of Australian lamb.", "More than half of all Australian beef is MSA-graded.", "By resisting the system, Tattykeel risked cutting itself off from its branding and international certification, including the US Department of Agriculture shield.", "Nonetheless, it has set the record for stud stock prices and marketed\u00a0its lamb as a premium product.", "\"We've had the argument for years with producers and MLA,\" Mr Gilmore said.", "\"We're at a point now where we don't need to knock what they're doing.\""]
